Text.Value: That monster was using you like a puppet.
Start by handing over your valuables.
It looked like you were helping that thing.
Nowhere I can find on a map. I know Baldur's Gate is a few days downriver, but -

EditorData.NodeContext: Unable to help and regretful of it

Text.Value: I remember getting close and... hearing a voice. It said we were special. That we could help.

EditorData.NodeContext: A note of mingled awe and horror as he speaks of the powerful creature they found

Text.Value: It's all... it's like a dream. What happened? What's going on?

EditorData.NodeContext: Starting to remember the horrors that occured, still not fully believing it

Text.Value: We saw the crash from the river. We were too scared to move at first, but that thing... spoke to us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Recounting the story of the crash as if remembering it piece by piece

Text.Value: This voice in your head - what was it saying?
First things first. Where are we?
Wait. Your... your mind. I can still feel it, like an echo. You... you're like that thing.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused, growing fear of us as he realises we're similar to the creature that controlled him.

Text.Value: We were on the river. We were afraid to come ashore, but then we heard... screaming.

EditorData.NodeContext: Recounting the story of the crash as if remembering it piece by piece

Text.Value: They tried to kill me. I killed them first.
It could be worse - your ship didn't fall from the sky.
Ah... ah, good luck to you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, fearful of you, just wants you to leave without getting angry

Text.Value: I... I see. I'm sorry - we meant no harm. We saw the crash, and then I remember... that thing. Its voice, in our minds.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to be gracious but a little fearful and very, very sad at the loss of his friends

Text.Value: What? I saved you from that thing.
We don't want trouble. We're leaving. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, fearful of you, just wants you to leave without getting angry

Text.Value: We saw the crash from the river. But even then we could... hear it. Feel it in our minds.

EditorData.NodeContext: Recounting the story of the crash as if remembering it piece by piece

Text.Value: We saw the crash and came to help. That... thing got a hold of us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of the creature the enthralled him - he doesn't even want to look at it, doesn't know what it is

Text.Value: We... we were ready to die for it. Came ashore so fast we crashed the boat. I... I don't know what we'll do, now.

EditorData.NodeContext: A note of mingled awe and horror - quietly helpless towards the end

Text.Value: You were protecting that creature.
Calm down. They did something to me, but I escaped.
I was defending myself. I'm sorry.
What? No - please!
You allowed the ghaik to use you. You're unclean.
Oh Umberlee spare us, no. My friends - what happened to them? What's going on?

EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet grief as he spots the bodies of his friend. Not entirely frantic, just breathless and sad

Text.Value: That... thing. It was speaking... in my head.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused, groggy - waking up from an alien's mental domination

Text.Value: That monster was using you like a puppet.
Perhaps. But I wouldn't like to tarry too long in this wilderness. We're -

EditorData.NodeContext: Unable to help and regretful of it

Text.Value: Figure it out yourself. I have neither time nor patience to train a new slave.
Calm yourself - you're safe now.
That... that we were special. That it needed our help.

EditorData.NodeContext: A note of awe and horror at a creature that spoke in his mind

Text.Value: It's... I'm not sure I want to remember.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hedging around a difficult memory

Text.Value: Whatever was happening, it ended with that monster.
Show some gratitude, or you'll find that I'm a lot worse.
A... a gayk? Whatever that thing is, it would have had me if not for you. We watched the crash from the river.

EditorData.NodeContext: We've just used the word 'ghaik' to describe the creature and he's repeating it phonetically, not understanding but trying to. We're just as strange to him as the alien, but he's trying to show gratitude for our help

Text.Value: Umberlee speed you on your way. Won't trouble you any further.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, fearful of you, just wants you to leave without getting angry

Text.Value: Oh Umberlee spare us, no. My friend - what happened to her? What's going on?

EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet grief as he spots the bodies of his friend. Not entirely frantic, just breathless and sad

Text.Value: You... of course. I did not think to meet a drow in this wilderness, least of all -

EditorData.NodeContext: Intimidated by us but trying to be polite and grateful

Text.Value: You tried to kill me, that's what.
Your boat - can it be repaired?
Please. We're grateful for your help, truly... but we don't want any more trouble. We'll go, all right? We'll go!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frightened, fearful, not wanting to anger us but aiming to get away from us as quickly as possible

Text.Value: I'm truly, truly glad we weren't able. Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grateful

Text.Value: Please. I'm grateful for your help, truly... but I don't want any more trouble. I'll go, all right? I'll go!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frightened, fearful, not wanting to anger us but aiming to get away from us as quickly as possible

Text.Value: I just... I just remember digging.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hedging around a difficult memory

Text.Value: I... I understand. Just... please know that we meant no harm.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to be gracious but quietly devastated at the loss of his friends

Text.Value: You were... you were on that thing? Heading where? This is the middle of nowhere -

EditorData.NodeContext: Awe of us

Text.Value: Oh Umberlee spare us, no. My friend - what happened to him? What's going on?

EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet grief as he spots the bodies of his friend. Not entirely frantic, just breathless and sad
